errors.validation.minimum: Expect number larger than or equal to {minimum}
errors.validation.maximum: Expect number smaller than or equal to {maximum}
errors.validation.minLength: Expect string with length greater than or equal to {expected, plural, one{1 character} other{# characters}}
errors.validation.maxLength: Expect string with length less than or equal to {expected, plural, one{1 character} other{# characters}}

errors.password-policy.password-reused: Password cannot be reused, please check password policies below
errors.password-policy.containing-exclud: Password contains excluded keywords, please check password policies below
errors.password-policy.unknown: Password is invalid; please check password policies

TodoButtonWrapper.dialog-message: This feature is not yet implemented
ScreenNav.label: Top-level tab navigation
NavBreadcrumb.label: Nested navigation
AppsScreen.title: Select Project
CreateAppScreen.title: Create a new project
CreateAppScreen.desc: Answer a few question, and we can quickly setup authentication for your apps!
CreateAppScreen.app-id.label: What is the name of your project?
CreateAppScreen.error.invalid-app-id: Invalid Project ID. Project ID should start and end with lowercase alphanumeric characters or numbers, and it should contain only lowercase alphanumeric characters, numbers or '-'
Onboarding.title: Configure your project
Onboarding.desc: Here are a series of questions to help you configure the authentication scenario. You can further configure other settings in the Portal after this setup wizard.
Onboarding.identities.label: How can a user identify themselves?
Onboarding.identities.username-only-aler: We don't recommend using Username without Email or Phone. It's always easier for end-users to remember their email / phone for login, and it also serve purposes like forgot password etc.
Onboarding.identities.anonymous-users-on: We don't recommend enable anonymous user only without other identities. Enabling other identities allow end-users to promote their account and login their account again.
Onboarding.primary-authenticators.title: What should be the primary authenticator authentication?
Onboarding.primary-authenticators.toolti: If you select Username, only Password will be supported
Onboarding.secondary-authenticators.titl: How should a user perform two-factor authentication
Onboarding.secondary-authentication-mode: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) enhance security of your end-user greatly! According to {ExternalLink, react, href{https://security.googleblog.com/2019/05/new-research-how-effective-is-basic.html} children{research}} simply having SMS as 2FA block 100% of automated bots, 96% of bulk phishing attacks, and 76% of targeted attacks. Using on-device 2FA is even better at handling targeted attacks!
Required if user has Mutli-factor Authenticator
Onboarding.verification.desc: If verification is optional, the user is not required to perform verification at account creation. The user can later trigger verification at the settings page.
Onboarding.upgrade.label: Upgrade
Onboarding.upgrade.support-sms.title: Upgrade plan to use SMS
Onboarding.upgrade.support-sms.desc: Add passwordless login and one-time-password via SMS for your app users by upgrading your plan later.
OnboardingCompletion.title: Done
OnboardingCompletion.desc: You can always change these configuration in the portal, or configure an even more complicated authentication system.
OnboardingCompletion.completion-message: You just setup a full feature login, signup and setting page for your next app!
OnboardingCompletion.signup-login.title: Sign up & Login
OnboardingCompletion.signup-login.desc: You just setup a full feature login, signup and setting page for your next app!
OnboardingCompletion.settings.title: Setting Page
OnboardingCompletion.settings.desc: After your first sign up, you will be redirected to a setting page. {br, react} {br, react} You can change where to redirect users after sign up or login, and trigger setting page from your apps.
OnboardingCompletion.sso.title: Single-Sign On Setting
OnboardingCompletion.sso.desc: You need to configure different social logins setting in the portal.
OnboardingCompletion.now-you-may.title: Now you may
Continue to Portal for further Customization
OnboardingCompletion.now-you-may.doc.lab: Learn how to integrate Authgear in minutes with your web / mobile apps.
UsersScreen.title: Users
AddUserScreen.title: Add User
AddUserScreen.user-info.label: Fill in 1 of the following fields:
AddUserScreen.password.label: Password
AddUserScreen.add-user.label: Add User
AddUserScreen.cannot-add-user: Please enable at least one of username, email or phone in authentication screen
UserDetailsScreen.title: User Details
SetUserDisabledDialog.disableUser.title: Disable User
SetUserDisabledDialog.disableUser.text: Do you really want to disable user {username}? Disabling the user {username} will forbid them from logging in. Their existing sessions will also become invalid.
SetUserDisabledDialog.enableUser.title: Enable User
SetUserDisabledDialog.enableUser.text: Do you really want to enable user {username}? Enable the user {username} so that they can login again. Their existing sessions can resume.
SetUserDisabledDialog.generic-error: Failed to set user disabled status.
DeleteUserDialog.title: Remove User
DeleteUserDialog.text: Are you really want to remove user {username}? This action cannot be undone.
UserDetails.account-security.remove-conf: Are you sure you want to remove authenticator {authenticatorName}
ResetPasswordScreen.title: Reset Password
UserDetails.connected-identities.title: Identities
UserDetails.connected-identities.confirm: Are you sure you want to remove identity {identityName}
UserDetails.connected-identities.verify-: Failed to set verified status of identity claim
CreateIdentity.require-login-id: You need to add "login_id" to identities list in authgear config
AddEmailScreen.title: Add Email
AddEmailScreen.email.label: Email
AddPhoneScreen.title: Add Phone
AddPhoneScreen.phone.label: Phone Number
AddPhoneScreen.country-code.label: Country Code
AddUsernameScreen.title: Add Username
AddUsernameScreen.username.label: Username
AddUsernameScreen.password.label: Password
UserDetails.session.confirm-dialog.revok: Are you sure to terminate this session of the user?
Are you sure to terminate all sessions of the user?
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.title: Login ID
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.columns.order: Higher priority Login ID will be shown first. E.g. if you enable both phone and email as Login ID and phone have higher priority, it will show Phone number first in login and signup screen
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.error.calling: Require at least 1 active calling code
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.modify-: Forbid the user to add, update, or delete email after signup
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.title: Email Address
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.ignoreD: Ignore dot (.) in local part (e.g. john.doe@acme.com = johndoe@acme.com)
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.blockPl: Disallow plus (+) in local part (e.g. john+app1@gmail.com)
Some email provider use "+" as an alias for multiple email forwarding to the same address. Enable this option if you want a stricter uniqueness for users per email account.
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.domainB: Require domain allowlist disabled. {br, react} {br, react} To enable domain blocklist, you will need to input email domains that you want to block in the below text field. (e.g. example.com)
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.blockFr: Block email addresses from free email provider domains
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.domainA: Require domain blocklist disabled. {br, react} {br, react} To enable domain allowlist, you will need to input email domains that you want to allow in the below text field. (e.g. example.com)
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.username.modi: Forbid the user to add, update, or delete username after signup
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.username.excl: To enable exclude keywords, you will need to input the keywords that you want to block in the below text field.
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.phone.title: Phone Number
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.phone.presele: Pre-select the country calling code by the IP address of the user
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.phone.modify-: Forbid the user to add, update, or delete phone number after signup
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.title: Authenticators
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.descrip: Configure how you want users to authenticate themselves (such as Password), and any MFA requirements
Required if user has Multi-factor Authenticator
Required if user enabled Multi-factor Authenticator
Allow user to retrieve or regenerate recovery code again
Disable "Do not ask again on this device" for the Multi-factor Auth
VerificationConfigurationScreen.title: User Verification
VerificationConfigurationScreen.descript: Configure if the email or phone number of your users could be verified and if it is required
VerificationConfigurationScreen.criteria: At least one user's email/phone is verified
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.title: Anonymous Users
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.descri: Enable or disable anonymous users. Anonymous users do not have identity. They can be promoted to normal users.
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.confli: User identity conflict when promote to normal user
BiometricConfigurationScreen.title: Biometric Authentication
BiometricConfigurationScreen.description: Enable or disable biometric authentication. Enable biometric authentication allows existing user using Biometric login to login their account.
BiometricConfigurationScreen.list-enable: Show biometric logins list in setting page
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.title: Single-Sign On
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.descript: Configure and enable your users to login via SSO. Read the {ExternalLink, react, href{{HREF}} children{SSO integration guide}} if you need help
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.widget.m: Forbid the user to connect or disconnect after signup
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.widget.w: For mobile app only, to receive delegate call when user click on login with WeChat button.
OAuthBranding.azureadv2: Sign in with Microsoft Azure AD
OAuthBranding.adfs: Sign in with Microsoft AD FS
OAuthBranding.wechat.web: Sign in with WeChat (Web/网站应用)
OAuthBranding.wechat.mobile: Sign in with WeChat (Mobile/移动应用)
PasswordPolicyConfigurationScreen.title: Password Policy
PasswordPolicyConfigurationScreen.descri: Configure the password policy if Password is configurate as primary authenticators.
PasswordPolicyConfigurationScreen.histor: No. of password history to keep
ForgotPasswordConfigurationScreen.title: Password Reset Code
ApplicationsConfigurationScreen.title: Applications
ApplicationsConfigurationScreen.client-e:
Configure applications to be used at the endpoint: {ExternalLink, react, href{{clientEndpoint}} children{{clientEndpoint}}}.
You can change this endpoint at the {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{dnsUrl}} children{Custom Domains configuration}} with your custom domains.
ApplicationsConfigurationScreen.cors.des: Configure cross-origin resource sharing (CORS), allowing HTTP requests from the list of domains specified here.
CreateOAuthClientScreen.title: Create Application
EditOAuthClientScreen.title: Edit Application
ModifyOAuthClientForm.redirect-uris-tool: Users will be redirected to this path after they have authenticated.
ModifyOAuthClientForm.post-logout-redire: Users will be redirected to this path after they have logged out.
ModifyOAuthClientForm.issue-jwt-access-t: Using JWT as access token allows easier access token decoding
ModifyOAuthClientForm.token-settings.des: For use with {strong, react, children{token-based}} authentication, usually native module apps or single-page apps.
ModifyOAuthClientForm.cookie-settings.de: For use with {strong, react, children{cookie-based}} authentication, usually websites
ModifyOAuthClientForm.cookie-settings.li: Change cookie session lifetime and timeout in the {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{to}} children{Cookie Session Settings}}.
CustomDomainListScreen.title: Custom Domains
CustomDomainListScreen.desc: You can add a custom domain so that users will login via, for example, “identity.yourdomain.com”. In this case, a session cookie of domain “yourdomain.com” is written so that your websites can share the session cookies under “*.yourdomain.com” for better customers experiences.
CustomDomainListScreen.delete-domain-dia: Are you sure you want to delete {domain}
You have no permission to delete domain
CustomDomainListScreen.activate-domain-d: Are you sure you want to activate {domain}? Only one domain can be active.
VerifyDomainScreen.title: Verify Domain
VerifyDomainScreen.desc-main: Setup CNAME and add TXT record below to your DNS provider to verify your own
VerifyDomainScreen.error.non-custom-veri: Cannot find domain which is non-custom and verified
VerifyDomainScreen.error.duplicated-erro: Requested domain is already in use
VerifyDomainScreen.error.not-custom-erro: Requested domain is not a custom domain
ManageLanguageWidget.title: Language
ManageLanguageWidget.default-language-de: For any languages you don’t provide localization, your default language will be used.
UISettingsScreen.title: UI Settings
UISettingsScreen.description: Authgear comes with some simple styling for your login and signup page. You can customize the look and feel here.
UISettingsScreen.favicon-description: Upload a 32x32 pixel ICO, PNG, GIF or PNG below 100 KB
UISettingsScreen.app-name-label: It will be used as some placeholder text for your authentication screen, emails, etc. You can always change it later.
UISettingsScreen.privacy-policy-link-des: This link can lead users to your privacy policy
UISettingsScreen.terms-of-service-link-d: This link can lead users to your terms of service
UISettingsScreen.customer-support-link-d: This link can lead users to your custom support
UISettingsScreen.default-client-uri-desc: If this link is provided, a Back to Your App link will be shown in the settings.
UISettingsScreen.default-redirect-uri-de: If this link is provided, the user will be redirected after login with non-OAuth flow.
UISettingsScreen.default-post-logout-red: If this link is provided, the user will be redirected after logout with non-OAuth flow.
UISettingsScreen.branding.title: Authgear branding
UISettingsScreen.branding.disable-authge: Display Authgear logo in Login and Signup page
LocalizationConfigurationScreen.title: Localization
EditTemplatesWidget.translationjson.subt: Translations for the web UI as well as app brandings like app name
EditTemplatesWidget.custom-css.title: Custom CSS
EditTemplatesWidget.custom-css.subtitle: Custom CSS to be included in every page

InviteAdminScreen.email.label: Email
InviteAdminScreen.add-user.label: Add User
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.title: Admin Invitation
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.login.label: Login
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.accept.label: Accept
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.invalid-emai: The invitee email does not match your email. Did you log in a different user?
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.invalid-code: The invite link is invalid or expired. Please contact the admin to resent an invite.
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.not-authenti: You're invited to join Authgear with a tenent called {appID}
You will need to create a new Authgear account or login to your existing account.
The invitee email does not match your logged in email
Try logout and login as a different user?
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.is-invitee.t: Confirm your invitation to join the tenant {appID}
AcceptAdminInvitationScreen.is-invitee.d: You will join the tenant with admin access by clicking the Accept button below.
GeneralSettings.app-id.label: App ID
SessionConfigurationWidget.title: Cookie Session Settings
SessionConfigurationWidget.description: Configure the cookie session settings for {ExternalLink, react, href{{endpoint}} children{{endpoint}}}.{br, react}If you only use token-based authentication, you can simply ignore this section.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.title: Webhooks
WebhookConfigurationScreen.description: Authgear can deliver webhook events to your server when important events such as new user signup happen.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.timeout.label: Per-handler timeout (seconds)
WebhookConfigurationScreen.blocking-even: Blocking Events allow your server to check and abort operations in different scenarios. {br, react} {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks#blocking-events} children{Learn more about blocking events}}.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.non-blocking-: Non Blocking Events allow your server to receive notification asynchronously when an event happens in Authgear. {br, react} {br, react} All events will be sent to the configured endpoint, you can filter event by the type in payload. {br, react} {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks#non-blocking-events} children{Learn more about non-blocking events}}.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.signature.des: Each webhook event request is signed with a secret key. You must validate the signature to ensure the request originates from Authgear. The signature is calculated as the hex encoded value of HMAC-SHA256 of the request body and is set as the HTTP header {code, react, children{x-authgear-body-signature}}. {br, react} {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks/webhooks#check-the-webhook-signatures} children{Learn more about validating the signature}}
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.title: Admin API
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.description: The Admin API allows your server to manage your project and users via a GraphQL endpoint.
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.keys.title: List of Admin API keys
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.graphiql.des: Inspect the GraphQL schema and build queries with {ExternalLink, react, href{{graphqlEndpoint}} children{GraphiQL}}.{br, react}On your server you should always use the Admin API endpoint and the API keys.
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.graphiql.war: Please beware this is {strong, react, children{NOT}} a sandbox environment, changes are made to {strong, react, children{REAL DATA}}.
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.api-endpoint: Accessing the Admin API GraphQL endpoint requires your server to generate a valid JWT and include it as {code, react, children{Authorization}} HTTP header. Read {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/apis/admin-apis} children{the doc}} for more details.
ModifiedIndicator.confirm-dialog.title: Reset Form State
ModifiedIndicator.confirm-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to reset form to initial state?
FormContainer.reset-dialog.title: Discard unsaved changes
FormContainer.reset-dialog.message: Are you sure you want to discard unsaved changes?
ShowUnhandledValidationErrorCause.title: Validation error
ThemeConfigurationWidget.app-logo-descri: It helps the end users to identify your app, and it is shown in all pages, emails, etc. JPEG, PNG and GIF are supported.{br, react}(Size limit: 100 KB)
ThemePreviewWidget.login-to-continue: Log in to continue to Authgear
ThemePreviewWidget.azureadv2-button-labe: Sign in with Microsoft Azure AD
ThemePreviewWidget.adfs-button-label: Sign in with Microsoft AD FS
ThemePreviewWidget.disclaimer: By registering, you agree to our {a, react, className{{className}} children{Terms of Service}} and {a, react, className{{className}} children{Privacy Policy}}

AuditLogEntryScreen.title: Log Details
FeatureConfig.disabled: The grayed out features are not available for your project plan. {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{Upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.custom-domain.disabled: Custom domains are not available for your project plan. {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{Upgrade your project plan}}.
FeatureConfig.white-labeling.disabled: To hide Authgear branding in your app. {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{Upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.oauth-clients.maximum: You can only add {maximum, plural, one{1 application} other{# applications}} at once on your plan. To add more, {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.sso.maximum: You can only add {maximum, plural, one{1 social connection} other{# social connections}} at once on your plan. To add more, {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.webhook.blocking-events.di: Blocking event webhook is not available for your project plan. {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{Upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.webhook.non-blocking-event: Non blocking event webhook is not available for your project plan. {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{Upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.webhook.blocking-events.ma: You can only add {maximum, plural, one{1 blocking event handler} other{# blocking event handlers}} at once on your plan. To add more, {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.webhook.non-blocking-event: You can only add {maximum, plural, one{1 non-blocking event endpoint} other{# non-blocking event endpoints}} at once on your plan. To add more, {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.
FeatureConfig.audit-log.retrieval-days: You can only retrieve audit logs for the last {logRetrievalDays, plural, one{1 day} other{# days}}. To retrieve more logs, {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{planPagePath}} children{upgrade your project plan} target{_blank}}.

SubscriptionScreen.plan-features.desc: Check out more details and compare plan features on our {ExternalLink, react, href{https://www.authgear.com/pricing#compare-plans} children{pricing page}}.
SMTPConfigurationScreen.title: Custom Email Provider
SMTPConfigurationScreen.description: Optimize for email deliverability by using your own SMTP server to send Authgear Emails (such as password reset code, verification) in your own domains
SMTPConfigurationScreen.enable.label: Use my own provider
SMTPConfigurationScreen.host.label: Host
SMTPConfigurationScreen.host.tooltip: Hostname or IP address of your SMTP server
SMTPConfigurationScreen.port.label: Port
SMTPConfigurationScreen.port.tooltip: Port of your SMTP server. Typical values are 25, 465, 587. Avoid using port 25 if you can, since many providers have limitations on this port.
SMTPConfigurationScreen.username.label: Username
SMTPConfigurationScreen.password.label: Password
SMTPConfigurationScreen.send-test-email-: Test your SMTP configuration by sending an email to the given address.
SMTPConfigurationScreen.sendgrid.descrip: Sign up for a SengGrid account and generate a SendGrid API Key. Check {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/customize/custom-email-provider} children{our instructions}} if you need help.
SMTPConfigurationScreen.custom.descripti: Set your SMTP provider manually. Check {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/customize/custom-email-provider} children{our instructions}} if you need help.
